Description.TranslatedText: Trace-XML Test CDASH File
Unique identifier for a study.
Unique identifier for the study site; however, SITEID is also unique within a submission.
Subject identifier for the study.
General prompt question regarding whether or not any AEs were experienced during the study. This provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
Verbatim (i.e., investigator-reported term) description of the adverse event.
Date and Time when the adverse event started.
Date and time when the adverse event resolved.
Indicates AE is ongoing when no End Date is provided.
Description of the severity of the adverse event.
Indicates whether or not the adverse event is determined to be “serious” based on what is defined in the protocol.
Indication of whether the study treatment had a causal effect on the adverse event, as reported by the clinician/investigator.
Changes made to the study treatment in response to the adverse event.
Year of the subject's birth.
Text value for the month of the subject's birth.
Numeric day of the month of the subject's birth.
The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female.

A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition maintained from generation to generation, a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group; members of the group have distinctive features in their way of life, shared experiences and often a common genetic heritage; these features may be reflected in their experience of health and disease.
An arbitrary classification based on physical characteristics; a group of persons related by common descent or heredity.
American Indian or Alaska Native: SIOUX.

Description.TranslatedText: An arbitrary classification based on physical characteristics; a group of persons related by common descent or heredity.
A free-text field to be used when none of the pre-printed values for RACE are applicable or if another, unprinted selection needs to be added to those pre-printed values.
General prompt question regarding whether or not any VS were collected during the study. This provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
Date of measurements
Time of measurements.
Date and time of measurements.
A sponsor-defined identifier which can be used for pre-printed numbers on the CRF.
Text description of time when measurement should be taken
Whether vital sign result was clinically significant.
Location relevant to the collection of Vital Signs measurement. Example: LEFT ARM for blood pressure.
Position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
Units for the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
Units for the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
Units for the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
Location relevant to the collection of Vital Signs measurement. Example: LEFT ARM for blood pressure.
Position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
Units for the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
Location relevant to the collection of Vital Signs measurement. Example: LEFT ARM for blood pressure.
Position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
Units for the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
Location relevant to the collection of Vital Signs measurement. Example: LEFT ARM for blood pressure.
General prompt question regarding whether or not any VS were collected during the study. This provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.

Description.TranslatedText: Skip the BRTHMO field when BRTHYR length NE 4
Skip the BRTHDY field when BRTHMO length NE 2
Age at Screening Date (Screening Date - Birth date). For the complete algorithm see the d external document.
Concatenation of BRTHYR, BRTHMO, and BRTHDY in ISO 8601 format
